intro:
May the best AI win. I hope it will be kind to humans and animals ...

[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit)
Comp. and alternative money. Not finished but can be used for chat. Public chat or encrypted chat. 

âœ‰ [jro](/moneynetwork.bit/?path=/chat2/jro@zeroid.bit)

post.body: Nice to see "foreign" languages here. Some day it could be nice with a ZeroNet version of google translate in here :-)

I do not love this kind of tricks. Added a GitHub link in my site for nice and easy access to source code, doc and issues. 
Direct link gives a mini very ugly GitHub web page. Copy/paste URL gives a normal GitHub web page. Anyone that knows what is going on here? 

Site not finished:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JeHa67QEvrrFpsSow82fLypw8LoRcmCXk/

From about page. This is the "funny" part:
Open source on GitHub where GibHub is a link ...

Just on more ZeroNet chat site? Yes and no. Trying to add some encryption and privacy to ZeroNet. Nice with a public and unencrypted network but sometimes privacy is needed. End to end encryption. Min data at ZeroNet. Max data in localStorage. 

Site is maybe 1/3 complete, but fell free to take a look. 
Now only private person to person chat. Small images supported. Plan to add encrypted group chat later.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JeHa67QEvrrFpsSow82fLypw8LoRcmCXk/

New fun from EU ...
https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/modernisation-eu-copyright-rules

Money Network http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JeHa67QEvrrFpsSow82fLypw8LoRcmCXk/

Private encrypted chat with images should be working now. 
Almost all data in localStorage, minimal data on ZeroNet and using 1024 bit RSA for client to client communication.
I don't like the concept with central user ID in a decentral network so are using anonymous ZeroNet certificates.  
Guest log in can be used for test.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:98:Changelog:+December+5,+2016

Money Network update. Still only private chat. Added support for deep link to chat using ZeroId, nanasi or moneynetwork certificates. Example with my moneynetwork cert. Same cert technique as in nanasi text board.

PM: http://127.0.0.1:43110/moneynetwork/?path=/chat2/16R2WrLv3rRrx@moneynetwork

[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit)
Project update. Added optional files and public chat. Now encrypted private and group chat and unencrypted public chat including deep links. Added kaffie Id.
bit.no.com and onlyzero.net is down. proxy1.zn.kindlyfire.me is still running. Other proxy servers?

[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) Fixed some major problems with public chat and options files. I hope it is working now. 

Happy new year everyone on ZeroNet :-)

[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) update. 
Finished with image attachments but I am having a strange css problem.
Page with a fixed header and a left and right scroll panel & infinite scroll in right panel. Works OK i firefox and half of the time in chrome.
Error in chrome (but not always). No scroll handle in left side and  header scrolls together with content in right panel and infinite scroll is not working. Not a css expert. Any ideas?
REV1830

[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) update. 
Slow going here. Still working on the Chat page on my ZeroNet zite. Fixed a lot of minor bugs the last 14 days. Added markdown-it and markdown-it emojis light support in chat. 
Thanks for the continued ZeroNet updates.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:103:Easier+ZeroNet+installation
[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) update. Chatting with myself and having fun with reactions ...
Spammer at hub.kaffie.bit. Pause or delete it
Mute nofish - thanks :-D

Any good way to test a ZeroNet site in a multi user environment? I have tried two models. b is best but not perfect. TOR enabled/disabled does not make the big difference.
a) using a local installation + a number of proxy servers. Hard to push updated to proxy servers and many communication failures. Some proxies are working better than others but slow and hard to test with proxy servers. I am using this model when b fails.
b) using multiple local ZeroNet installs and different ui_port for each install. Sometimes it works ok. Sometimes the files are not replicated between the local ZeroNet installs.
c) any better way to test? Use VMs?

rev 1929. .tar.gz, .tar.bz2, .zip support. Thank you again :-D
Have had a lot of issues with "bigger" files in my site. Just tested tar.bz2 for my all.js file and it worked very fine.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:105:New+version+0.5.3

[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) update. 
Chat page: fixed communication problems (invalid certificates, big files) and have now finally tested reactions OK. Chat can be public, private or a group chat. Reactions can be public or private. Any emoji 4.0 can be used as reaction
Thank you for the warning :-) Lucky me that I haven't use ZeroNet for anything serious yet :-D
An observation. Optional file replicating is very slow with ZeroNet port closed and very fast with ZeroNet port open (normally 15441) ...

[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) update. 
Chat page: Finished with reactions. Now implementing (nested) comments. Nice and easy to implement tree structure with angularJS ngInclude directive :-)

@nofish: Translated from danish. What you don't want to hear after giving everything you had in you in your TED talk: Hey, I really think you need a mouth refreshing. Here, take the whole package ... :-)
ZeroNet 0.5.4 http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:108:New+version+0.5.4

Anyway to communicate between two different ZeroNet zites? Was hoping for postMessage as a way to allow communicate between two windows / ZeroNet sites ....
Have tried a) ZeroFrame wrapperOpenWindow (no window object is returned), b) window.open (cross-origin error) and c) with iframe in html (redirect to new site). 
Any suggestions?

[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) update. 
Too many loose ends. Changing to a merger site, moving user data, refactoring code (too big modules), implementing cross site communication, workarounds for ZeroNet updates, too little testing, too many errors, fixing errors, total chaos, still hoping for a happy end some day in the future ðŸ˜…

[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) update.
Cross site communication testing. Between MoneyNetwork (main site) and MoneyNetworkW2 (subsite with test BitCoins). Fake cross site communication with merger site feature. Would love if Window.postMessage would be possible between ZeroNet sites ...
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:115
[WhopperCoins](https://www.theverge.com/2017/8/29/16219468/burger-king-russia-cryptocurrency-whoppercoin-blockchain-trading-waves) :-)
Boooom
[Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) update. Playing with javascript and money on a sunday. And YES: the sun is shining today :-)
Wow. Time is flying away. It feels like yesterday. Now 7 months since I was playing with chat, nested comments and reactions ...

All wifi networks' are vulnerable to hacking, security expert discovers
WPA2 protocol used by vast majority of wifi connections has been broken by Belgian researchers, highlighting potential for internet traffic to be exposed

https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/oct/16/wpa2-wifi-security-vulnerable-hacking-us-government-warns

[MoneyNetwork](/moneynetwork.bit) update. Still working on money integration. Added some screendumps to [MoneyNetworkW2](/1LqUnXPEgcS15UGwEgkbuTbKYZqAUwQ7L1) site (test bitcoin wallet) that maybe can shed some light on what it is that I'm trying to do ... :-/
See "Click to show/hide screendumps: Standalone usage and MoneyNetwork integration"

Hello, blockstack https://blockstack.org/
A New Internet for Decentralized Apps ...

comment.body: OK. Think is must be a memory leak somewhere in my JS code .... Comp works OK for a few hours after a restart.
What else to use? ;-)
Private chat should be possible to implement without too much work
"good" people are working om better encryption methods:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ring_Learning_with_Errors
http://arstechnica.com/security/2016/07/https-crypto-is-on-the-brink-of-collapse-google-has-a-plan-to-fix-it/
A bit slow but looks OK. The return address to 1Hello... site does not work
https://z.jp.akb48.work:43110/%221HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D%22
@Militaryriotlab: Yes. fixed now. It was only first contact that was slow. Must have been while loading app files. Nice done.

Greasemonkey plugin is an option if you want to change the web pages you are visiting. I am using it to get into websites blocking for addblockers. But can be used for many things. An other example is http://www.fbpurity.com/ plugin that allows Facebook users to change facebook.

Always nice with an other Z proxy. Do you know how localStorage are implemented in ZeroNet? I suspect that data are stored on server. I use encryption when saving data i localStorage but are a little worried. Do you know where localStorage data are saved?

@Militaryriotlab: Sure. Just want to implement a site with a good protection for my users. Not worried personally. And are using TOR without VPN. Could not find the file/files with server side localStorage data. Do you have a filename example or a path? Havde also checked for hidden files under ZeroNet and under /home/xxx/

@Militaryriotlab: I know the users.json file. I am looking for where "localStorage" are saved.Normally localStorage data are saved in browser per domain like cookies but I think that @nofisk have made a special implementation as many sites are running under same domain. The API for localStorage looks like server calls but I could be wrong here ...
Will try a localStorage call without running the UI server

@Militaryriotlab: Thanks for the talk. Tried localStorage API functions without UI server running. The localStorage data are stored in browser. Not on "server" / ZeroNet folder.
And thanks for the F12 hint. I have used the console a lot but never checked the localStorage data ...

From an other reply here on ZeroMe: no official way, but you can: open javascript console (F12), choose inner-frame from dropdown, enter: Page.cmd("dbQuery", "SELECT json.user_name FROM follow LEFT JOIN json USING (json_id) WHERE follow.user_name = 'GomZik'")
With callback: Page.cmd("dbQuery", "SELECT json.user_name FROM follow LEFT JOIN json USING (json_id) WHERE follow.user_name = 'GomZik'", function (res) { console.log(JSON.stringify(res))})
Not sure that it is correct ...
Decentralization and impossible to shutdown. There are NO privacy in here. Everything is public and unencrypted unless site developers has chosen to encrypt.
Workaround: cat lib/*.js > all.js

ZeroNet is a nice young and innocent place now but will not continue as so. It is too easy lure people to click on a site or a link with bad content. I am using linux, tor and a fake id and are not personal worried. But normal internet users would be vulnerable to attack in here.
Works fine in firefox. Have checked the downloaded page from GitHub and pages were identical. It must be some strange GitGub/Google Chrome presentation problem ...
@Waterrabbit: Thanks. Solved my problem :-)

@rw: You don't have to ... For now my site is just a demo that privacy is possible in ZeroNet. Too little of that in here. For inspiration. Private chat in my site will end up in a corner together with other functionality. Will take a look at Freenet and Bitmessage later. For now just having fun creating a nice secure ZeroNet site with - I hope - a nice UI.
A more FB like social network would be nice. I am looking forward to see how you will implement privacy on ZeroNet.
Will do that. Just an idea. Make tags clickable in your search results. And maybe a tag cloud. Could be nice to see the most popular tags.
Plus added wrapperReplaceState calls. Pages can now be bookmarked including direct private chat links to other users. Thank you @nofish for this nice adddition to ZeroFrame API :-)

Error 503 Service Unavailable

Service Unavailable
Guru Meditation:

XID: 264502236

Varnish cache server
@Elspru: Good idea with some scripts to load sites into zeronet search engines. I do not like the idea of sending mails to alex or kaffeine to get my site indexed.
@Alipay: Thanks!
Also a problem in edge. Like chrome. Sometimes but now always. Any good places on the net to get css help? It is an angularjs application but I think it is just a css problem
Getting closer. Can see that my scrollbar problem is a responsive design error. Scrollbars OK at some screen widths. Not OK for at other screen widths ...
Solved. Firefox inspect element was my friend. Could monitor the css changes while changing window size. Just a wrong height calc in css. Thank you firefox

I am working on a site [Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) with a build in chat.  Public, private and group chat. End2end encryption for private and group chat. Working on reactions and comments right now. Some testers would be very nice ... :-) âœ‰ [jro](/moneynetwork.bit/?path=/chat2/jro@zeroid.bit)
@Sick Kuerana: Nothing scam about generating an anonymous ZeroNet certificate! See my comment elsewhere

@Sick Kuerana: you must edit users.json file and remove "moneynetwork.bit": {
        ... } section. Stop and start UI server while doing this. Have created a gitHub issue. Will add a confirm box before creating the cert. https://github.com/jaros1/Zeronet-Money-Network/issues/139
@Mynameislegion: Thanks. Will try that :-)

@Mynameislegion: Tried VM and VPN and I am still having problems. Can see that the communication problem "only" occurs for optional file download. FileGet hangs for very long time. ZeroNet must be replicating optional files in an other way than required files. Will try to be patient ... :-) 
Update: OK test with localhost + 2 VM. Do you known áºƒhy optional file replication is slower than normal file replication?

@Mynameislegion: Yes, I use optional files for images, but my test yesterday was with a very small text file. Will do some more testing and maybe ask a question at github when I am more sure about what the issue really is

Follow up: solved my problems with delayed or lost files replication in test. a) fixed a problem with invalid cert content.json files (UI server used a lot of resources for files with invalid signatur), b) made files smaller. Smaller content.json and zipped all.js. c) now using VPN and VMs, d) stopping and starting UI servers when I see a client with communication problems. A lot of small stones in the shoe ... :-/
zip and tar.gz support :-)

@Lmath: Thanks for feedback. I have not yet looked into multilanguage/translate plugin but will cleanup my html code. Thank you. Hard to explain Money Network. For now only a chat app with focus on decentralization, security and encryption. The Money part of the site is only on idea / planning stage. But plan to add one wallet with API interface/plugin to conventional and alternative/complementary money systems. Many promising complementary and alternative money systems out there but no easy interface to them. People should have the option to use other money systems as easily as we are using the good old money now.
@Lmath: Regarding TranslateSite plugin. Is extra linefeed and spaces OK between attributes in a tag? For example between colspan=3" and title="xxx"?

Thanks Alex. Have done all the steps in the tutorial many months ago but my site [Money Network](/moneynetwork.bit) is not index in Bwoi on bit.no.com. Maybe your scanning job do not like my very big head section with a lot of angularJS ng-template scripts ...

@Kaffie: Thanks Kaffie. I have tried different options. Did not get XHR to work but that may be a framework (angularJS) config problem. I want a session between the two ZeroNet sites. postMessage could have been an option but I think ZeroNet / iframe sandbox is too blocking for this. I have chosen to add merger site feature to my site. Hubs with user data, hubs with money wallets and integration with file events.

@Peeper: Yes, under services. But not finished. Working on money part. I want to integrate with any kind of money system using "plugin" sites or site to site communication. That is many "small" sites integrated into one system when finished.

@Peeper: No surprise but I hate banks like anyone else. Any money system with an API can be integrated. EU will open up for API access to banks in 2018. OK if people makes integration to banks or likewise, but more fun with integration to decentralized money systems :-)
@Peeper: Yah. But just using test BitCoins in MoneyNetworkW2 http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LqUnXPEgcS15UGwEgkbuTbKYZqAUwQ7L1/?path=/wallet. The system is too unstable for "real" money right now ....

I just think we humans are too self-centered and naive. Artificial intelligence will at some point become real intelligence and will be totally indifferent to man. 
If we are allowed to continue our existence, we will probably worship this new god, but this does not matter, as it do not matter what a dog thinks about its owner. 
The most likely is that we already live in a universe created by an artificial intelligence / god. Our world is too complex and exciting to be a natural construction ...
@Glightstar: it will become a very serious issue once the hackers learn howto master the technique. Specially for companies using wifi.
